page.title: 01CARHARRACK.
page.content: The village of Carharrack in the Parish of Gwennap is found in what was once referred to as the "richest square mile on earth." It was so called because of its wealth taken from the{mining}of tin and copper. Today the area is littered with the remnants of this long gone era. There are many ruined pumping engines and chimneys, spoil heaps and dangers from many old mine shafts (many of them unmapped.) The area known as United Downs is now entering a period of hoped for prosperity with a major land{ {reclamation}scheme. Hundreds of new trees have been planted and the land developed to be used as small{ {industrial}units. Much of the surrounding area is farmland,with the{farms}used mainly for the grazing of cattle.
